review: L Game, CEO Ratio'd, Black Widow on TOP. Overwatch? More like Underwatch, Under 6ft. Concord is better.

Alright, let's actually provide a constructive review. Why are people "review bombing" Overwatch 2?

We paid for Overwatch, we supported it throughout its lifespan, it was popular and liked by its community, and turning a happy profit each year.

When Blizzard announced Overwatch 2, the big new feature they announced, the entire premise that made it "worth the sequel treatment" was the PvE campaign mode. Hero talent trees, customizable abilities, an expansive co-op campaign that would add to the story and lore. We were told it was going to be so much work that they wouldn't be putting out updates for Overwatch any more, they were re-allocating the staff to work on this new project.

With no updates, and no content, Overwatch started to get stale... people grew tired and bored, spending less time in the game, or moving on. Many of us stuck with the product, playing a little each week just to keep fresh... waiting for the new campaign mode. For a lot of us, playing became a chore, something we were doing out of habit, so we'd be ready for the new campaign...

But the new campaign wasn't the premise that established OW2, it was the pretext. It was a lie. Blizzard abandoned the PvE campaign a full YEAR before OW2 launched - but continued to push it in marketing as the big new feature. It's even in the announcement trailer for OW2, and on the roadmaps. They knew they'd canned it 12 months earlier, but they knew that's what people wanted, so kept putting it front and centre to get people's money, to get people to buy into the project. They took our trust and monetized it.

-----

What does OW2 ACTUALLY offer then? What did they work on for those two years that was so important that they couldn't make content for OW1, the product people paid for and were supporting?

1) They overhauled the graphical engine:

Before, Overwatch would play on a relatively low spec computer, and it'd be smooth. Now, it stutters and stammers in the menus. They've added this weird shiny plastic finish to everything in the world, heroes and environment alike - so where before, heros would "pop" against the background and be easy to follow, now everything has the same texture to it, and it all merges together into visual noise - especially at longer ranges. They've compensated for how bad this looks by adding lots of additional flashy effects and explosions, that makes it much harder to see anything amidst the chaos. A PvP game at this pace relies heavily on quick disambiguation of what you're looking at, so you can react and compete, and the new engine makes this impossible without turning all the effects back off... meaning that the two years of development is for a feature best disabled.

The new engine also has a weird slippery "feel" to it. Reviewers who'd played Overwatch for 50 hours came into Overwatch 2 and reported "look! it's the same Overwatch you love, but it's F2P now! Just ignore the monetization and you can play this great game for free!" Established long term players with thousands of hours were on reddit complaining that their hitboxes were all over the place and shots that would previously "feel" like a dead certain hit were just completely whiffing, and they didn't understand why. All the timings are messed up.

2) They reworked most of the heroes:

TLDR: they screwed up the game balance. Previously, one of the biggest appeals of Overwatch was that you could find a hero that suited your play style, and main them, getting good at whatever suited you best. Some people like sniping, or hitscan run and gun, some people aren't good at reactionary aim and instead liked to focus on positioning, tactics and strategy. You could make a big positive different to your team by playing lucio or mercy, and paying attention to your surroundings, and positioning yourself in the right place at the right time to make the difference.

With Overwatch 2, the damage and healing behaviour has been reworked heavily. Now, the one tank on the team is insanely chunky, and it's near impossible to kill them quickly - with healer support, they can just stand in the line of fire and laugh. Everyone else dies almost immediately, regardless of who their aggressor is.

Team-fighting now is very one-note, you have one tank who's immortal if they have support, and you have four hitscan DPS characters following them - there's not a lot of difference between supports and DPS characters. The teams try to pick off the other team's DPS/Support characters, and when they pick a few off, they can finish the tank and take the objective. Repeat. There's no room for variation in play style at all, you either play a DPS and try to kill the other team DPS, or you play a tank, and try to position correctly - maybe picking off an enemy hero that gets too close to you.

I understand a lot of this came from feedback at the professional levels, where support players were complaining that they wanted to have more direct impact in teamfights, they wanted the game to feel more like other FPS games - but for a large portion of Overwatch's playerbase specifically, the appeal of the game was that you could do something else and still matter.

3. They got INCREDIBLY greedy with the monetization...

It's a longstanding argument that lootboxes are terrible in modern gaming... but Overwatch was one of the few examples of Lootboxes done right. Most of the long-term players of the game actually liked the system, that just rewarded you for playing the game and let you unlock whatever content you wanted relatively quickly. I started playing OW1 with the first anniversary, cleared the weekly boxes from arcade every week, and at the launch of OW2, I owned every single item in the game. Those who didn't have the time to invest in doing everything could still quickly unlock specific items they wanted (and let's be honest, when you have your favourite skin, how much do you care about unlocking other skins?) - and those who didn't want to spend hours unlocking stuff could spend a little cash to get it - if they wanted to.

The new system puts almost everything behind a paywall. The minute number of cosmetics on the "free" track are often insultingly lazy, simple recolours or minor alterations, while they put serious effort into skins that you can only buy for $20. The content you can unlock by grinding often feels like it only exists to drag you into interfaces that advertise the paid content for you. Even content from the first game, that was originally free, is now paid only.

Battlepass systems suck. "Pay us for the opportunity to unlock stuff if you play a lot. If you don't you have to pay us more, or lose the stuff you already paid for." - Limited time deals, rotating shop offers, FOMO FOMO FOMO... it reeks of manipulation and insincerity.

4. Occasional DLC packs of PvE adventures.

These are Blizzard's "new" approach to PvE. Occasional mission packs where you can get a little bit of story and a PvE mission. You can pay (in my UK currency) £13 for the DLC pack, or £35 (the cost of a good indie game" for the "ultimate bundle".

So here's the thing - this content is the same amount of content, and the same pace of release as the old mission scenarios - it's just now, instead of them being a free event to get people excited about playing and encourage their friends to join up - now they're paid DLC.

Nobody likes paying a regular subscription for a product that they previously owned completely. It doesn't make anyone like Adobe Photoshop or Microsoft Office, and it doesn't make anyone like Blizzard.

-----

So this is why people are "review bombing" your game. You took something we paid for, supported and enjoyed for years, lied to us about your plans, and turned it into trash. Now you're telling us to pay for features and content we previously enjoyed in the game we paid for. It's greedy, it's cynical, it's manipulative, and you've lost our trust.

And thank god Bobby is gone

First of all, don't disregard this review just because I have only 30 minutes of time played.
I have 600+ hours in Battle-net version of OW and I downloaded it on Steam only to leave this review.
I'm going to delete it right after, cause, well... Why would I need two copies of Overwatch on my PC?

Second, I want to address the elephant in the room - 300k reviews with only 20% positive.
Is it because the game is bad? No. It's because of the following reasons:
1) People are mad that PvE was cancelled (which IS sad, but leaving a bad review ain't gonna help with that)
2) Sex jokes (Haha, very funny. This joke sure didn't get old and cringey after being repeated for 8 years)
3) People, who just hate OW2 (especially TF2 players)
Why people, who never played OW, hate it? Simple, really: it's because hating OW is popular.
Come to some gaming community and make post/comment/review that says "Overwatch is le bad" and sweet-sweet internet points will flow to you like a waterfall. A tale as old as time.

Okay, enough discussing outside stuff, let's talk about the game itself.
It's a masterpiece.
A genuine masterpiece of a game and one of the best games I've ever played (and definitely best Multiplayer one).
So many amazing stories and so much lore in this universe. So many characters with their own unique and interesting kits and personalities. Just by walking around you already can feel the character you've picked, and it becomes even better when you use their abilities and hear their voice-lines. Aside from the amazing writing of ability lines and the banter between characters, they all have amazing performances from their voice actors.

Are there any flaws in the game? Well...
Balancing is sometimes a bit clunky. I don't blame devs for that, since balancing a game like OW with its amount of characters, abilities and their interactions is a Herculean task. The most important part is that developers are always trying to make the game better, and that's all that I could ask from them.
The matchmaking is also sometimes a bit silly, some games will result in steamroll or in being steamrolled. Unfortunately, you can only move on from such victory/defeat.
Oh, and Kiriko. PLEASE, STOP GIVING HER SKINS. SHE HAS MORE THEN ENOUGH FOR A NEXT 5 YEARS. I BEG YOU, LET THIS NIGHTMARE END.

Oh, by the way, remember monetization that people love blaming in this game?
And like, yes, 20 dollars of currency per legendary hero skin is REALLY crazy, but it's not OW's fault - literally any other live-service game has similar and even worse prices. It's a state of the industry, not of one game.
The BP's are very tasty btw - 8 skins (5 legendary and 3 epics), +80 prisms to buy a mythic skin (with customization and special effects!), bunch of other stuff like POTGs or emotes and all of that only for a price of 10 dollars of currency!
Don't want to pay? Farm free BP's to get 600 gold each season and try out Microsoft points for some extra gold once in a while.

I think before ending I also should mention one interesting fact.
Do you know how many GOTY awards OW got back in the day?
102, according to Wikipedia. This game was a real phenomenon and was talked about EVERYWHERE.
Do you really think a bad game would get THIS much of recognition?
I surely don't.
And I surely do think that this game became only better with flow of these past 8 years.

To sum it up, Overwatch is a fantastic game. It's very fun to play and fun to talk about.
I love it with all my heart, I love it's characters, I love it's maps (not you, Numbani), the game-design, the voice-performances. I will happily spent a hour or two in this game every evening or even more with a good team/friends.
I really, really recommend you to check it out despite all the people that talk bad about the game. After all, you can't regret trying something new, right?

Most/all of my playtime is on the Battle net app but I wanted a few hours on steam before leaving a review. The game will always get a bad rep for what the 2 represents in the name. But it's a game that's kept me imprisoned entertained for 8 years and I still find it fun to play.

The things they need to improve on/Constructive criticism:

1. Skin buying simulator: Honestly, each season is starting to feel like the only content we get is skins. It's not as bad if we get a fun game mode like Season 13's Junkenstein Lab, but it feels like content outside of skins is drip-fed. Take "classic overwatch"; instead of making it a great 1-time event (like the blog post made it sound like) and having a different meta each week, we get to launch overwatch with no hero limit for 3 weeks and another "classic overwatch" for the next 2 seasons (I know they said they were adding a limit, but by the time that happened, I had already had enough of that patch and have no idea if they ever even added the limit.). Season 14's announcement had "Returning events" as a key selling point: Winter Wonderland (has been run for the past 7-8 years, every year) and Lunar New Year (again has been run every year for the past 7-8 years, every year). With these events returning, we get nothing new; we get the same modes that we've had before that, to be honest, aren't that popular (except Prop Hunt, which, in my opinion, should be a rotating arcade mode, but we gotta have something to make the event look like something other than a skin drop, right?). Edit: Locking a Weapon "Flourish" inspect behind an €80 weapon skin (With a special bundle for only €40! 🙄) is just scummy, you could've given a basic one (as shown in the launch trailer) to each hero and then charged for a special one that comes with these weapon skins.

2. The balance: Occasionally they get it right, for a short time anyway. Then we get an Orisa micro buff, or a Mauga micro buff, or maybe a Hog micro buff, and if that doesn't break them, no need to worry; next patch at least one of them will break, and then the cycle can continue. There are heroes that are unfun to play against and, personally, unfun to play as. It sometimes feels like these are the only tanks they want to buff, and heroes that feel more fair, like Junkerqueen, get a random nerf because... I still don't know, to be honest (I don't like playing tank in general, but going against a Queen, I don't mind because I feel like I can at least fight her off on other heroes). I get that balance can be hard, especially with the varied skill levels of players, but if a hero is hard dominating in the highest ranks, then it needs immediate action. It might be faster than Overwatch 1 balance, but heroes are often left feeling oppressive and making people just not want to play the game. We might get a balance patch before midseason or before the next season, but those are few and far between, and 4+ weeks of having no fun while trying to play the game is hurting the community more than more reactionary patches would. To be honest, there are a few problem heroes I'm sure, but Hog, Orisa, and Mauga have been a pain point since the start of Overwatch 2 and for Mauga since his launch season (where people literally left comp games to go buy the battle pass because he was locked behind it and he was THAT oppressive).

3. Progression: There is a progression system that was added in Overwatch 2. I have no idea what progression level I am, because, to be honest (again), there is no point in it. There's hero progression, and you get a little player name card for playing a hero, but I don't feel like I've progressed anywhere. Overwatch had borders; these were very simple, but they were something always visible in-game, and something I personally always knew what level I was. With that system, when you got 1 level, you got a loot box; this is something that shouldn't return. But also with that system, when you reached level 100, you got a star for your boarder and started at 0 again to continue progressing and being rewarded along the way. Why can't we have a similar system, where if we hit level 100 we get a special border upgrade that changes with each 100 levels (make it the same amount of time it took in OW1, Which was a fair bit) and we get a reward, 100 Overwatch Coins, it won't break the blizzard bank and will let players feel like their time isn't wasted because if you want anything in this game cosmetic wise you better open your wallet, but that goes back to point 1: There is no content in this game apart from skins to buy with no way to earn them outside of 600 coins, not enough for an epic skin nevermind a legendary in the battlepass that is limited by there only being one in a 9 week period, so time spent playing the game after finishing the battle pass for a season is essentially wasted, you get nothing, too bad (I'd personally be fine with that if we got new gameplay content but that doesn't happen either)

4. Just drop the 2: It's a constant reminder of a promise never fulfilled and it sours player perception of a game they'll never truly have.

This is more of a vent than a review, I guess, and it doesn't even cover all the things I want them to improve. I still love this game, and I want it to succeed, but Blizzard needs to actually take steps to improve player pain points (there are little signs that they are trying, but they're moving at an 80-year old snail's pace) and stop treating it as a skin simulator with an FPS paint job.

Zafere Giden Yolda Bir Kahraman Ol!"

Overwatch 2, takım tabanlı FPS türüne yepyeni bir soluk getiren, dinamik ve adrenalin dolu bir deneyim. Blizzard, birinci oyunun temel taşlarını alıp modern oyuncu kitlesine hitap edecek şekilde ustalıkla geliştirmiş. Ancak bu oyun yalnızca bir devam oyunu değil; aynı zamanda yepyeni bir macera ve rekabetin zirvesi!

Olumlu Yanlar:
Karakter Çeşitliliği: Tanktan hasar dağıtıcıya, destekten stratejik oyun kuruculara kadar herkes için bir kahraman var. Her karakterin kendine özgü oyun stili, yetenekleri ve kişiliği, oyunu taze ve heyecanlı tutuyor. Favori karakterinizi bulmak başlı başına bir serüven!
Görsellik ve Tasarım: Canlı renk paleti, mükemmel animasyonlar ve harita detayları, Blizzard'ın sanat anlayışını bir kez daha kanıtlıyor. Haritalar sizi dünyayı dolaştıran bir serüvene çıkarırken, görseller gözlerinize bayram ettiriyor.
5v5 Formatı: Orijinal oyunun 6v6 formatından 5v5’e geçiş, maçların daha stratejik ve tempolu geçmesini sağlıyor. Daha az kaos, daha çok strateji!
Eğlenceli Modlar: Sadece rekabetçi değil, sıradan oyunlardan Arcade modlarına kadar herkesin eğlenebileceği içerikler var. Ayrıca etkinlikler sırasında gelen özel modlar, oyuna olan bağlılığı artırıyor.
Olumsuz Yanlar:
Kozmetik ve Battle Pass Sistemi: Eskiden ücretsiz sunulan ödüller, şimdi Battle Pass ve mikro ödemelere bağlı. Oyuncuları bu konuda memnun etmek için daha cömert bir yaklaşım beklerdim.
Öğrenme Eğrisi: Takım tabanlı bir oyun olduğundan, yeni başlayanların hızlıca adapte olması zor olabiliyor. Deneyimsiz oyuncular için bu durum bazen moral bozucu hale gelebilir.
PvE İçerik Eksikliği: Başlangıçta vaat edilen PvE deneyimi beklentileri karşılamaktan uzak. Umarım gelecekte daha kapsamlı içerikler eklenir.
Sonuç:
Overwatch 2, FPS ve takım çalışması temelli oyunları sevenler için bir başyapıt olmaya çok yakın. Blizzard'ın detaylara verdiği önem, her karakterin özenle tasarlanmış olması ve strateji gerektiren dinamik yapısı, oyunu saatlerce keyifle oynamanızı sağlıyor. Elbette geliştirilmesi gereken yönleri var, ancak oyunun geleceği fazlasıyla parlak görünüyor.

Puan: 8.5/10

An evil game designed by evil people.
Its all rigged.
This game isn't competitive. Its digital heroine designed to give you the most amount of artificial dopamine.
Game uses manipulative matchmaking systems that force you to keep playing.
The outcome of EVERY single match you play is predetermined.
You will never get to the top ranks, unless you are a shill streamer/youtuber.

*EOMM (Engagement optimized matchmaking - a tiktok like matchmaking algorithm that makes you not win or lose too many games in a row. You will get literal bots on your team when the game wants you to lose in order to get an emotional response from you so you are more likely to queue up again. It learns your queue patterns and manipulates you by feeding you artificial dopamine and turns you into a mindless zombie consumer american slave. There's a lot about EOMM online, reading about it is very interesting and disturbing at the same time. Every modern "competitive" video game uses this form of matchmaking nowadays. Riot games perfected this disgusting system with the league of legends social experiment and then sold it to other companies.)

*DDA (Dynamic difficulty adjustment- if you're winning a game you are supposed to lose, the system manipulates the game in real time to help the losing team make a comeback by giving them massive hitbox and hitreg advantages.)

This is 100% true and confirmed by the developers themselves and yet people still keep playing the game.
The game itself is trash and keeps getting worse every year, but I have no time to type about all its fails.

Game's really good rn.
Joined during the "all time low" time of the game, before the "scrap" of the PVE mode, and have for sure seen some interesting hero designs and marketing choices made during my time playing (more than 220 hours, I've played on blizzard's launcher for a while).
HOWEVER
Of course people that played 10000+ hours are getting bored since 2016, of course the game getting on steam just after the big drama wasn't the best idea with reviewbombers jumping at games throats for (sometimes) quite insignificant things. The PVE would have been nice, but we are still getting some of it with the (yes i know it was planned to be free) purchasable DLC (and I think most of the players that wanted the PvE were ow1 player, and ow1 wasn't free either, most of new ow2 players wanted to play the PvP modes for free first and foremost), and we are still getting some cool PvE events, including returning ones on top, that's very cool imo. The decision to scrap it with all the cool features teased wasn't a very fair one when you promised it to players, but there are reasons, and people that haven't even touched back on the game shouldn't criticize it purely for that.
. The game still has very cool designs, both visually, storywise and gameplaywise. Most the heros have good kits, except a few (that could be reworked, it has happened). The mechanics feel as good to land and snappy as always, and the roster and maps list are evolving regularly.
And the new direction of the game, since Juno's launch, seems very promising. The two new heroes are cleverly designed, healthy for the game, and just plain fun. The game as a whole is better, with more new and returning events AND "experiments" where the devs listen to the community and try new ways for the game to play (namely 6v6 is coming back, and a less strict role queue is getting tested).
There are still some clear weak spots in the game tho. Some skins are ways too expensive, and always seem to go to the same heroes (Venture will get their second skin next season CONFIRMED!!! I'm sure it's a byproduct of the mess blizzard was in at the time, I hope they'll get more skins later) although i have to say that going into the game i was expecting to never get any skins for free, but you can get a free premium battle pass every two seasons, and some skins you can get after literally ONE game (75 ow coins, or whatever the grey currency is called).

OVERWATCH (OW)
OverWatch 1 y 2

Nota: 9,0 / 10

-OverWatch es una Leyenda de los Videojuegos.

El Mejor Heroe Shooter.
Creador y expandidor de un genero y rey indiscutible de él. Incluso con sus momentos altos y bajos.

Positivo:
-Heroes: (Heroes frescos, habilidades bonitas y útiles, vistoso, desprenden personalidad).
-Skins: Buenas Skins y Colaboraciones, etc...
-Jugabilidad tipica de Heroe Shooter.
(Pero es en parte su distintivo)
-A nivel de mecanicas y sensaciones buenas.
-Amigos: Jugar con Amigos muy jajas y divertido.
-Mapas: Muy buenos y legendarios. (Solo hay 3 o 4 mapas malos).
-Armas, las armas y sus sensaciones son buenas.
-Habilidades buenas e interesantes.
-Estadisticas buenas y rankings aceptables.
-Sonido muy bueno.
-TTK muy bueno.
PING: Bueno

Negativo:
-Precios de algunas skins muy caras.
-Compañeros de equipos en ranked muy inútiles y malos bastantes veces.
-Banneos: El Sistema que te bannen por decir cualquier tonteria (generacion de cristal) es una mierda y es toxico.
(No puede ser que te bannen por tonterias tan tontas).
-Equilibro: Ha habido periodos de epocas que el balanceo a tardado mucho en llegar.

Resumen:
-Un Gran Juego, bien hecho para su época y muy divertido en el que tengo muchos recuerdos.

PD: Lo del nombre de Overwatch a 2 sobra y es una tonteria.

Overwatch 2, несмотря на высокие ожидания, оказывается разочарованием для многих поклонников оригинальной игры. Во-первых, отсутствие значительных новшеств в игровом процессе делает его похожим на DLC, а не на полноценное продолжение. Механики остались прежними, и старые герои практически не получили значительных изменений, что делает игру скучной.

Во-вторых, система монетизации вызывает недовольство: слишком много контента locked behind paywalls, что превращает игру в аренду, а не в актив, который можно развивать. Бесплатный доступ к игре также сопровождается проблемами с балансом, где бесплатные игроки постоянно сталкиваются с платными персонажами, которые могут иметь заметные преимущества.

Кроме того, отсутствие четкого направления в поддержке и обновлениях вызывает вопросы о будущем игры. Ситуация с багами и недочетами также не улучшает обстановку — стабильности серверов и оптимизации не хватает. В итоге, Overwatch 2, кажется, не оправдывает надежд, и многие фанаты начинают задаться вопросом о целесообразности дальнейших инвестиций в этот проект.

Quitting this game is on the same level as quitting smoking or drinking. This is the simplest way to explain. Those who want more details can read the rest.

As you know, even the R18 content of the game is included. So yes, you can impose this on yourself for every character, of course. Maybe you are in the game for an obvious reason of your favourite character? Anyways. If you are interested in the part R18, this can also become one of the reasons for addiction.

However, the game will get better in the future, so I'll keep playing. I am calling out to those who think like it will probably get better after I continue. The rates, costumes and statistics you accumulate in the game may be nice for you, but remember that it only takes your time. If you don't have a friend environment or if you hang out alone, the parts you already think about are even more hellish. In short, this is one of the addictions.

There are a lot of people who play the game just to play the game, and as I said, ‘play to play’ or ‘be able to play’. Then there are those who play for fun or to relieve stress. You can't do the stress part, it's not that kind of game. you can't do anything like reduce stress in this kind of game anyway, and if you can, you're either playing very well or your imagination is your superpower. I have experience with it and it's funny when I think about what I'm doing. Because even the slightest imbalance messes this part up. The fun part is like this. If you've become robotic or AI, consider quitting, but only if you can still have fun. Either you have a friend environment and you are playing in a combined way for 5 or 6 people. Or you are a psychopath, you are trying to continue and have fun by constantly consoling yourself while playing. I saw someone who made a really self-consoling comment. She/he talks about his mum or something and then says don't feel bad. Why we shouldn't feel bad? We're supposed to feel really good about the chaotic disharmony in the match, yeah. Also, ur mom or dad may have said the right thing, but even doesn't know it's about the game.
Motivational channel motivates better, if you really need it, go and find one of these. They're all nonsense. No, I mean, how can you console yourself and play? If you have a talent for self-deception, please become an actor. Anyway, I overreacted again.

If you say I play for the skin/costume, that's up to you. This is the direction that most people are currently unwittingly drawn to. I don't even recommend becoming a collector in-game. Become a collector in a more realistic environment or in a promising game. Still, it hurts a lot after the game is closed. I say this because I experienced once. This is the lowest level of addiction of them all. I mean, if you're obsessed, it can be the strongest, of course.

It's just a pity for the efforts I made when this game was good. I've managed to quit recently and I feel much happier. Only good things are the skins/costumes, nothing else. I really miss Overwatch, but there's no way it can go back to that time. I bought a prepaid card for this game at the time, then gave all my money to Overwatch: Origins Edition. Seriously, that's what this was all about? I remember I loved that game at the time. It wasn't just the number ‘2’ at the end. for me it was the player control, which was not completely free, and the mismatch in the match. Including the audience and maybe the content that develops over time. The game has its own charm, that's not a lie, but it's not as consistent as before, so it's a mess right now. There is no need to go into this part in more detail.

I wrote a very long comment here and deleted it. Consider only 5 times the upper part. I really don't think it's worth it. I mean, if it was worth it, the game wouldn't have turned out like this. At the moment they were ignoring the users because of the paying part. Now this has started to decrease and another rival game has appeared. Nowadays, I see the news of 6vs6. I just know it won't see the same value.
If someone who starts this game cannot get rid of his addictions, he/she will not be able to get rid of this game. Especially if that person is a new player.

Anyway, I'm done.

J'aimerais commencer cette évaluation en disant que j'ai eu beaucoup de fun sur le jeu, j'ai facilement plus de 200 heures sur le launcher de blizzard et je pense que je suis apte a donner mon avis. Cependant mon évaluation est négatives puisque récemment le jeu est devenu un des plus gros cash grab que j'ai vu. Les mises a jour, autrefois complètes et riches ne sont maintenant plus que des skins, des nouveaux skins qui ne sortent que sur les mêmes héros. Des armes a 40 euros. Sans parler des promesses non tenues et des mensonges que l'équipe balance aux joueurs pour les hype alors que rien ne sort finalement. Enfin le jeu conscient de son état actuel tends a revenir au stade d'Overwatch 1, aveu de faiblesse pour ma part. Il existe d'autres jeux dans le style de celui ci qui valent 20x celui ci. Des jeux qui souhaitent offrir une vraie expérience de gameplay et pas simplement une boutique en ligne et un gameplay qui fonctionne tant qu'on ne creuse pas trop. Je ne recommande ce jeu à personne

Not bad, I have spent around 45 minutes completing captcha-s and email + sms verifications
Trying to log into an already existing account is a quick time event:
- you get code, a link you cannot copy, and a QR code that doesn't work
- the code expires in 14 minutes, you have to restart the captchas if you run out of time
- when you try to log in, each time you have to fill an increasing number of captchas (my pb is 10)
- the captcha has an increasing number of images, with dices on them which you have to sum up and try to find the one image that shows the amount required
- if you just fail one, you start over
- when you pass this part, there is 10% chance it doesn't show a random error
- in case it works, you need to either confirm with email or sms (tried both, sms is less boring)
- at this point you have a 20% chance that you get "Accept terms of service" page, otherwise you are logged out and start again
- if you manage to accept that, you can play the game

Time to beat: 45 minutes GLHF

Also, there is some kind of shooter game after this part, I do not recommend that one.
I like the shooting and the healing and the tanking. That parts is nice.
the balancing in this game is an actual joke

Yes, Blizzard is a terrible dumpster fire for what they did to our baby. However, I have seen nothing but positive changes as of late.

Contrary to the majority just immediately going on about the history of the game, this is coming from someone who has a full time commitment to several things in life, and just likes to play competitively. The past is the past. I want to be entertained now. I don't really care about what all went down. The game is fun. And this review is for those people that just want a legit answer of whether or not it is fun. Yes, but it's complicated. You need to play with friends. Or people that you have chemistry with. Or you will not have a good time. It is a hero based 5v5 fps, and people treat it like it is Call of Duty. You cannot win games unless you work together and all pull the same amount of weight. It's just how it goes.

Don't play this game if you're not innately competitive. And actually have a life outside of the game so that way you can come into it realizing when you're talking to people that don't leave their basements, and you're more inclined to just not get heated over small things like trash-talking and etcetera.

They're doing pretty good. Not great, but enough for me to say yeah, give it a go.

Mostly negative reviews for a reason.

I've been playing OW2 for about 2 years now and enjoyed most of my experience. But it is exactly like many other reviews have said, like a toxic relationship. The game is fun to play especially with friends, and has a great iconic cast of characters. ("Iconic" for one reason or another) But man as much fun as I have playing it, I also at the same time hate playing it.

I spent most of my time playing unranked until I eventually went into competitive. You would think unranked it suppose to be a little more chill, but no man. It is a toxic sweat fest in there most of the time. I've run into more chill people in competitive than in unranked. Sometimes I just want to learn new characters but get thrown into the most try hard sweaty unranked games. I can't tell you how many times I've run into smurf accounts in both competitive and unranked. It's just not fun.

Now I want to talk about skins and in the in game awards. Holy cow are the skins expensive as heck. $20 dollars is a lot to ask for a skin. The crossover skins cost a crazy premium close to like $30 dollars for one. And the freebattle pass sucks, you barely earn anything worth while even when you pay for the premium battlepass. I have literally no incentive to play this game.

And what the heck, I was really looking forward to the story missions! I first bought OW1 because I thought there was gonna be a story mode of some sort. (My fault for not looking into that.) I was really excited when I saw there was finally gonna be a story mode only to be slapped in the face by blizzard. That's a real cold slap.

Anyway I put a lot hours into this game but maybe its time to move on. See yall in Marvel Rivals, that game looks fun. I hope that game gets treated better than Overwatch.

addicting, a total waste of time, should be played in short sessions and a lighthearted attitude for the most fun. taking this game seriously will negatively impact your mental health. players in this game swallow their negative feelings and keep going, and at the end of your session you will feel worse than when you started.

I recommend avoiding taking comp serious unless you have friends to play with. Asia servers are full of mental-health type-beat behaviour on ranked. mostly no communication unless it's cute funny moments or really sad complaining and outbursts from stressed players.

Chanko Nabe (Sumo Wrestler Hot Pot)

Prep Time
20 mins
Cook Time
5 mins
Chicken Broth
1 hr 20 mins
Total Time
1 hr 45 mins

Ingredients (tbsp=15ml, cup=250ml)
Chicken Broth (make ahead)
1000ml / 2.1pt water
1 whole chicken carcass cut to half (about 600g)
1 piece konbu (5cm x 10cm / 2” x 4”)
Chanko Nabe Broth
750ml / 1.6pt chicken broth (made per the instruction, note 1)
100ml / 3.4oz cooking sake
1 tsp salt
2 tbsp mirin
½ tbsp soy sauce
2 tsp sesame oil
1 clove garlic grated
1 tsp ginger grated
Chanko Nabe Ingredients
6 Tsukune balls (note 2)
100g / 3.5oz pork belly thinly sliced
100g / 3.5oz chicken thigh fillet cut to bite size pieces
1 cluster bok choy (about 60g / 2.1oz)
150g / 5.3oz Chinese cabbage leaves
35g / 1.2oz carrot
1 stem shallot/scallions
2 shiitake mushrooms
25g / 0.9oz enoki mushrooms
4 slices kamaboko (5mm / 3⁄16" thick)
Instructions
Chicken Broth (make ahead)
Soak the konbu in a bowl of water (you will use this water later).

Bring water (not in ingredients) in a large pot to a boil, add the chicken carcass.
When it starts boiling again and the surface of the chicken carcass becomes white, drain and rinse the chicken carcass well, removing guts and other brown bits.

Add the chicken carcass and the konbu to the pot. Add 1000ml / 2.1pt water including the water from the konbu to the pot and bring it to a boil.

Remove scum and reduce the heat to simmer. Cook for minimum 30 minutes, preferably 1 hour. Remove scum occasionally until no more brownish scum comes to the top.

Put through a sieve. If the amount of broth is less than 750ml / 1.6pt, add water.

Chanko Nabe Broth
Add all the Chanko Nabe Broth ingredients in a pot and bring it to a boil.
Turn the heat off and leave until required.
Preparing Ingredients
Bok choy: Remove outer leaves. Cut the central cluster of small leaves vertically to half or quarters depending on the thickness of the cluster. Wash well, particularly at the bottom of the stems where dirt collects. If the outer leaves are large, diagonally cut in half.

Chinese cabbage: If the leaf and the stem is very wide, halve vertically, then slice leaves diagonally. To diagonally slice, place the stem-end to the left (for a right hander) on the cutting board. Place a knife diagonally tilted to the right and slice the leaf diagonally to 5cm / 2” long pieces, by placing a knife.
Carrot: Cut a carrot to 5cm / 2” long, then slice vertically to 2-3mm / 1⁄16- ⅛” thick. If the rectangle is very wide, halve it vertically. Alternatively, slice the carrot diagonally.
Shallot/Scallions: Diagonally cut to 5cm / 2” long.
Shiitake mushrooms: Remove the stems. To decorate shiitake head (optional), make a shallow V-shape cut in the middle of the head, then another V-shape cut perpendicular to the first cut, making a cross (see the photo in the post).
Enoki mushrooms: Trim the end of the stems that are woody. If mushrooms are stuck together at the bottom, divide it into smaller bunches.

Serving
Place all the ingredients in a pot (note 3), clustering each ingredient together.
Add the broth to the pot and heat the pot on a portable stove (note 4).
Serve with small serving bowls.
Recipe Notes
1. If the chicken broth you made from scratch per this recipe is not enough, add water to make it 750ml / 1.6pt.

If you are in a hurry and do not have time to make chicken broth from scratch, skip the instructions for Chicken Broth and substitute 750ml / 1.6pt of chicken broth with 1 tablespoon of powdered chicken broth diluted in 750ml / 1.6pt boiling water. Omit salt as the powdered chicken bouillon usually contain sufficient amount of salt. Then, adjust the saltiness to your palate.

Asian chicken bouillon powder is the best for this hot pot, e.g. the Lee Kum Kee chicken bouillon powder that is sold at Asian grocery stores (see the photo in the post).

Do not use the Western-style chicken soup stock as the flavour is quite different.

2. Unless you are making Chanko Nabe soon after making Tsukune, it is a bit of an effort to make only a half dozen Tsukune for the hot pot. I usually save some when making Tsukune and freeze them. Thaw in the microwave before using.

3. A clay pot like the one in the post is ideal as it retains heat very well. If using a cooking pot, use a shallow pot of at least 10cm / 4” deep but not too deep. If the pot is too deep, it will be difficult to pick up food from the pot.

4. If you don’t have a portable stove to cook Chanko Nabe at the dining table, you can cook it on the cooktop and serve when all ingredients are cooked through.

5. After eating all the ingredients, you can add noodles to finish the meal. Since the broth is chicken based, either udon noodles or ramen noodles are best suited.

-Queue times are very slow when it comes to certain Arcade modes

This game is not what it once was and has lost a lot of the original luster that made playing it compelling. While it may still have a place in a library for killing time via a grinding game play loop, the maps, the modes, and the overall game play become tedious with time.

First and foremost the game requires team play in order to do well. While you may get some value from being good mech nically with a hero, that is limited if you can't synergize with your teammates. Most games you will find the team you're on is either rolling the other team or being rolled by the other team. Infrequently is there a game that is close and really comes down to the winning team eking out the win via a last-moment effort.

Probably the most insulting to the player is the desire of the developer to create an inclusive experience but fail miserably due to the core mechanics on how the game rates players' skill and ranks them. Higher ranks generally won't spend much time playing with lower ranks, and everyone is beating down those less skilled rather than looking to build them up. The measurement of skill and resulting rank is also highly questionable as a win or a loss contributes roughly 90% of the impact to a user's increase or decrease in ranking. If you happen to be on a team that wins, you'll benefit. If you happen to be on a team that loses, you'll suffer. The community does not help in this matter either as the prevailing thought seems to boil down to that win or loss being solely dependent upon your own play. Ironically, if your team happens to win, the community will happily point out more often than not it was because you were carried by the team. This ingrained double standard and focus on individual wins or losses for games makes the competitive experience laughable at best.

There are much better titles in the market today that provide much greater value than Overwatch 2 does.

I find it very unproductive that people just review bomb this game. There's things that didn't work out well in the past, like the PvE concept they wanted to bring out big in OW2 not panning out or the fact that OW1 received no new content from 2020 onward to the OW2 release in 2022. Sure, but neither of these things affects the state of the game now; the experience that players get. Furthermore, it's not like Blizzard intentionally let PvE fail or anything, but it just became clear that it's not a workable concept. If you try the optional Invasion mode, you'll quickly see why it didn't.

Moreover, OW1 needed a refresh. I know people will be all mad about 6v6 vs. 5v5, but the fact remains that in OW1, queue times for 6v6 shot up because nobody wanted to queue tank and the player base wasn't there for having two tanks. They discussed that in detail in a blog post a few months ago, I don't need to reiterate the point here. But it's also worth noting that a lot of people joined the game only with OW2 and never experienced 6v6 and are perfectly happy with the game as it were.

Then there's the removed Assault mode (2CP), which is now only accessible in custom games and the arcade. 2CP was just a bad game mode, it was unpopular and so unbalanced that even during OW1 times, two maps had to be removed from the rotation because they were so damn awful. Nobody wants that back.

OW2 also increased the number of events per year significantly and is way faster and reactive in bringing balance fixes and new content when compared to OW1. So that's not it, either.

No, the main reason people are upset is because they feel the monetisation changes with OW2 are worse than the lootboxes of OW1. Okay, look. I understand that skins are expensive, and heck, these collaboration bundles go for 50€ and more. That's a lot of money no question - but it's industry standard. Lootboxes have come under much more scrutiny in recent years, both from popular perception and legally. This model of outright purchases is honestly less abusive than having to gamble for skins hoping there's something for you in there, or for a character you even play. The free lootboxes of OW1 times weren't there because it was charitable, they were there to make you want to spend money on getting more rolls. Is that really what you want back, lootboxes? Then there's the battlepass. It's perfectly in line with what other games charge, usually has good content, you get enough prisms for a mythic skin each season, and there's free premium currency in there that would allow for buying the pass every other season without spending a penny on it.

I'm genuinely having a good time with the game, and I'm sorry to say it, but I can't agree with any of the review bomber's points. It feels to me as if old OW1 players are mad about things changing that had to change inevitably.

The Overwatch Classic event was the best thing that happened to Overwatch 2. Tried to continue playing, and I can confirm, its a horrible experience. Playing tank sucks, playing support sucks, playing dps is okay but barely. I don't know if it's because matchmaking sucks and just refuses to adjust skill rating in unranked/quickplay, but it was an immediately horrible experience.
Winning and losing almost evenly, and every win feels just as bad as a loss. Its so hard to explain without playing yourself, but all I can recommend is to just not to that. Seems like the only people left playing are those in full stacks and who have invested far too much time in the game and just have too much in it to quit.

I liked Overwatch 2 even when it first released and even into the newer heroes like Kiriko and Ramattra. I don't know what happened, but going from the Classic event to the regular game actually sucked so much.

Don't play the game. If you've been playing consistently and are still playing, you'll probably be fine. You'll want to end it all and hate yourself, maybe your a bit of a masochist, but you'll keep playing. If you're new, I don't see how you will enjoy this game if you are a new player.

But I'm just some guy, writing a Steam review because I really liked Overwatch, and after Classic it was a huge let down in its current state.
And I didn't even encounter a Mauga.

Goodluck, wait for Marvel Rivals or something and don't play this game.


P.s. Don't even get me started on the whole PVE ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that happened when OW2 first launched. I didn't leave a review then, but just look on the steam page and see "Overwhelmingly Negative" and you'll understand that people are pissed off, and that Blizzard majorly ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up, and continue to make poor decisions constantly.

Completely ruined the game with the removal of 6v6 and the following direction they took with 5v5 and hero balancing. Can't think of a single good point about the game these days, the only reason anyone has been playing it recently is either because they've spent a ridiculous amount of their life playing the game and can't give it up, or they release a 6v6 classic mode that brings the game back to a more enjoyable (and still somehow broken) state.

Seriously need to rethink their direction with this thing. 20% positive reviews ALL TIME on Steam should be a good enough indicator that they've ♥♥♥♥♥♥ something.

Basically, not worth playing unless theres a 6v6 classic mode, or until they rework the entire balancing system of the game so that 5v5 actually works, or better yet they go back to 6v6 (OR 7v7) and rework the heroes to suit. Sure its a lot of work, but if they actually want the game to succeed and have a decent reputation then its whats needed.

Pick up literally any other hero shooter, standard 5v5 FPS or 6v6 game over this absolute POS these days.

Points positifs :

Gameplay dynamique et nerveux : Chaque partie est unique grâce à la diversité des héros et des compétences. Le système 5v5 apporte un rythme plus fluide.

Graphismes colorés et soignés : L'univers est visuellement très plaisant, avec des maps bien conçues.

Chaque personnage a un style unique, ce qui permet à chacun de trouver son préféré.


Le système de battle pass et les microtransactions sont trop présents. Débloquer des skins ou des cosmétiques devient vite un grind.

Certains héros sont trop puissants ou trop faibles, ce qui peut rendre les parties frustrantes.

Les parties classées peuvent être déséquilibrées, surtout pour les joueurs solo.

Game sucks now but it used to be fun. Played it a lot back in the day but stopped playing when it was clear they were trying to balance the game around the worst kind of players and thus meant they had no clue what they were actually trying to accomplish. The conversion to Overwatch 2 was the nail in the coffin that finally sealed the fate of Overwatch. It's a shame because the game used to be fun and Overwatch Classic proved it. All the hours I have here on steam are solely because I reinstalled the game to play Overwatch Classic and ended up having a great time. It just reminded me of what we lost. Sure, a few of the changes here and there were good from launch Overwatch like fixing Roadhogs hook so that it doesn't grab you through walls and a handful of other balances. But all the horrible changes throughout the years outweigh the few good ones making Overwatch Classic much better than it's current state. Literally undoing 8 years of updates to the game is a genuine improvement and I have had more fun playing Overwatch Classic than at any point in at least the past 6-7 years of Overwatch. I would love to see Overwatch Classic with a few of the benefical character balances along with Ana and Overwatch 1 Orisa added to the mix but that will never happen. Basically, this game is only worth playing whenever they allow you to play Overwatch Classic, otherwise its wasted storage space and time. Sad!

GG RIP 05/12 -

Overwatch 2 tem sido alvo de críticas por vários motivos. A transição de um modelo de pagamento único para o modelo de "free-to-play" causou frustração, com muitas microtransações gananciosas de valores abusivos fora da realidade e um sistema de progressão que pode parecer grindy e injusto. Além disso, o jogo foi criticado por mudanças no balanceamento de heróisxsem sentido, algumas das quais afetaram negativamente a experiência de jogo, e pela falta de novos conteúdos consistentes. A sensação de que Overwatch 2 não trouxe inovações significativas, apesar de ser uma sequência, acabou por afastar uma parte da base de jogadores. ninguem joga mais essa bosta de jogo lixo.
GG RIP 05/12

Além das questões mencionadas anteriormente, Overwatch 2 também tem sido criticado em relação a aspectos de servidores, sistema ranqueado e práticas de monetização, que TODO MUNDO considera problemáticase desrespeitosas:

Problemas nos Servidores: Desde o lançamento, Overwatch 2 tem enfrentado problemas recorrentes com servidores. Muitos jogadores relatam dificuldades para entrar nas partidas, desconexões frequentes, lags e até mesmo quedas no serviço e latência alta. Isso afetou a experiência geral do jogo, especialmente em um título que depende de uma boa conexão para manter a competitividade.

Sistema Ranqueado: O sistema ranqueado tem gerado frustração entre os jogadores devido a sua falta de transparência e equilíbrio. Muitos sentem que o matchmaking é desigual, o que leva a partidas desequilibradas e muitas vezes frustrantes, onde o fator de "habilidade individual" parece ser ofuscado por fatores como a composição da equipe ou até mesmo a sorte. Além disso, as promoções e rebaixamentos de rank são vistas como imprevisíveis, o que afasta os jogadores competitivos que buscam uma progressão mais justa e consistente.

Ganância e Microtransações: A transição para o modelo "free-to-play" trouxe uma série de microtransações que os jogadores consideram excessivas e prejudiciais à experiência. Itens cosméticos, como skins e emotes, são pagos, mas o jogo também introduziu o sistema de Battle Pass, onde é necessário pagar para desbloquear conteúdos que poderiam ser obtidos sem custos em Overwatch 1. Isso tem sido visto como uma maneira de forçar os jogadores a gastar mais dinheiro para obter o que antes estava disponível por meio de conquistas no jogo. A introdução de skins exclusivas e a remoção de várias opções de personalização do jogo também têm sido criticadas por muitos como uma maneira de forçar a compra de itens pagos.

Em resumo, Overwatch 2 enfrenta uma série de críticas relacionadas ao seu desempenho técnico, à falta de um sistema ranqueado justo e ao seu modelo de monetização agressivo, o que tem impactado negativamente a experiência de muitos jogadores. A sensação de que o jogo prioriza lucros em vez de entregar uma experiência satisfatória tem sido um ponto de frustração crescente. nao vale a pena jogar esse lixo !! esperem pelo marvel rivals e GG ...

Overwatch 2

Overwatch 2 si presenta come una delusione per chi si aspettava un'evoluzione sostanziale rispetto al suo predecessore. Nonostante alcune aggiunte superficiali, il gioco manca di una vera innovazione e non giustifica pienamente l'uso del "2" nel titolo. La continua enfasi sul team play e sulla coordinazione rimane uno degli aspetti positivi, ma il resto del gioco è per certi versi un passo indietro rispetto al primo Overwatch.





Non c'è dubbio che Overwatch 2, come il suo predecessore, richieda una buona dose di coordinazione e lavoro di squadra. Le partite sono costruite attorno alla sinergia tra i membri della squadra, ma, purtroppo, questo non basta a salvare l'intero gioco. Sebbene la strategia e il coordinamento siano essenziali, molti elementi di gioco e le modalità sembrano ripetitivi e scarsamente innovativi, portando rapidamente a una sensazione di stagnazione.


La comunicazione tra i membri della squadra rimane cruciale, ma il gioco non riesce a stimolare l'interazione come dovrebbe. Le modalità e le mappe, che dovrebbero invogliare i giocatori a esplorare nuovi stili di gioco, sono semplicemente troppo simili a quelle del primo Overwatch. Le opzioni di gioco non riescono a risvegliare l'interesse come dovrebbero, e alla fine ogni partita diventa un ciclo monotono, piuttosto che un'esperienza fresca e coinvolgente.





Una delle critiche più gravi riguarda il modello di microtransazioni di Overwatch 2. Il gioco è invaso da acquisti in-game, per cosmetici e pass vari (con la rimozione delle casse gratuite presenti nel primo capitolo). Il gioco sebbene non sia un " pay to win" rende qualsiasi giocatore amante della personalizzazione obbligato a spendere soldi. Questo danneggia profondamente l'esperienza, portando alla frustrazione.


L’uso del "2" nel titolo è ingannevole. Overwatch 2 manca completamente di innovazione rispetto al primo capitolo. Le modalità, le mappe e i personaggi non sembrano evolversi in modo significativo, e la sensazione è che il gioco sia più un aggiornamento mascherato da sequel. Non c'è nulla che giustifichi l'esistenza di un "2", dato che il gioco si limita a rifinire e riproporre contenuti già visti, senza dare alcuna vera sensazione di novità. Per i fan del primo Overwatch, la transizione a questo nuovo capitolo è più una retrocessione che un miglioramento.


In definitiva, Overwatch 2 non è altro che una delusione per chi sperava in un vero e proprio passo avanti rispetto al primo Overwatch. La mancanza di innovazione e l'abuso delle microtransazioni rendono il gioco un'esperienza frustrante, in cui l'aspetto competitivo e il lavoro di squadra vengono offuscati dalla mancanza di contenuti utili. Questo sequel sembra più un tentativo di sfruttare la popolarità del primo gioco che un vero tentativo di creare qualcosa di nuovo, e lascia il giocatore con la sensazione di essere stato preso in giro.

Всем привет!

Никогда не думал, что напишу это про 2 овервотч, но игру правда допилили и исправили почти все косяки которые были на старте. Буквально вчера, играя в очередную катку я осознал, что мне совершенно не за что ругать данную игру. Кроме отсутствия ПВЕ конечно,
Далее отдельно пройдусь по положительным моментам:

1. Несколько раз меняли батл пасс за всё время и по итогу пришли к очень хорошей его концепции, где ты не внося денег можешь спокойно фармить как донатную валюту (на которую спокойно можно в последствии купить БП) так и простую валюту, на которую ты можешь купить большинство скинов.

2. Файты 5 на 5, когда только анонсировали игру, я думал, что это как то сюр, как количество игроков может в корне изменить геймплей? Оказывается может, все схватки стали менее душными из-за того что нет второго танка, файты стали более быстрыми и больше нацеленными на командную работу, тут прям нравится.

3. Новые герои. Они хорошие, некоторые правда подходят только для определённых режимов или ситуацией, но это даже хорошо, ибо ты в любой момент можешь переключить персонажа. Дизайн персонажей на уровне, у метелицы никогда не было с этим проблем. Единственное что вызывает потуги, это - Авентюра, небинарный персонаж, но думаю первый и единственный случай добавления этого нечто в игру, ибо хайп на повестку потихоньку спадает в мире.

Новые карты, режимы. Карт очень много перекочевало из первого овера, но так же периодически добавляются новые карты, по левел дизайну и визуалу они очень и очень хороши, видно, что люди, которые это делают играют в свою игру. Ввели во второй части несколько новых режимов игры, такие как толкание робота и, так называемые, точки возгорания. Толкание робота, наверное, один из моих любимых режимов, где расстановка сил может поменяться в одночасье:) Точки возгорания тоже приятно удивили, по сути это такой же захват, но только на карте 5 точек захвата и захватываются они последовательно, одна за другой, играется весело, а что ещё нужно нам от игр?

Единственное, ничего не могу сказать про рейтинговый режим игры, очень давно в него не играл, да и как то не хочется, сейчас для меня овервотч, игра, в которую я могу зайти после работы, отключить мозг и повеселиться от души, не смотря на победу или поражение в катке)

ive played overwatch many years on console, wanted to play on pc now, but i made a new account to link with steam (BIIIIIIIGGG MISTAKE), due to the madatory phone verification i still need to give my phone number, however 2 accounts 1 phonenumber is not allowed. So now i cant switch accounts anymore and am completley stuck, i figured out that i can delete my phonenumber off of my first account and then use it on my second, NOPE blizzard knows that its an already used phonenumber (im not sure thats leagl? so theyre saving that data even after you delete it ). The only thing left is for me to hit up blizzard support because a switch account button was toooooooo much of a forsight instead of that annoying pop up.

i also wanted to share my story of recovering my first account, because to do so i had to do a 20 step capcha, 20 STEPS of math questions ( no joke), this isnt a capcha btw, capchas use ai to figures out how your interacting with the website and your browser history as well as cookies and if that fits a human, thats why theres capchas with only 1 box to click. So what is this 20 step capcha, its so they can collect data, its purposley made to be impossible since it throws very hard math questions at you and if you get them wrong youre not a human and have to do 20 over again!!!!!!!!!! have you no shame blizzard

Скачал по факту ток чтобы отзыв оставить. Я сидел, я много думал (для меня это несвойственно) и пришёл к выводу, что могло быть хуже. Овервотч 2 можно сравнить наверное с какой-нибудь едой для "ценителей". Нет, речь не идёт про американо и лакрицу, речь идёт о засохших апельсинах и гнилых бананах. Это сьедобно? Впринципе да, но вот много ли людей захочет вкусить подобное? Наверное... да (судя по онлайну)? Но вот захочет ли нормальный человек такое есть? Нет конечно.
Так к чему я веду всю эту брейнротную ссанину? Хз, мне просто не нравится ов2, но я питаю тёплые воспоминания к первой части, поэтому мне не очень хочется обсирать эту игру прилюдно. Для бесплатной игрули - супер, но вот для игры на которую в своё время надо было отвалить немало шекелей - нет. Короче, ф2п ссанина.

Overwatch 2 bringt frischen Schwung ins bewährte Gameplay, vor allem durch die Umstellung auf 5v5-Matches, die für mehr Dynamik und Strategie sorgen. Neue Helden wie Kiriko und Sojourn sowie überarbeitete Klassiker bieten spannende Abwechslung. Grafisch bleibt der Stil treu, mit subtilen Verbesserungen und eindrucksvollen neuen Karten.

Der PvE-Modus enttäuscht jedoch mit begrenzter Tiefe, und die Monetarisierung durch Battle Pass und Skins stößt auf Kritik. Trotz dieser Schwächen bietet Overwatch 2 eine solide Weiterentwicklung für Fans des Originals.

Fazit: Gelungenes Gameplay, aber Luft nach oben bei PvE und Monetarisierung.

I like Overwatch it is a great game, this game has a lot of diversity unique heroes with different powers. I like the way blizzard frequently balance the roster to make it fair. I normally don't like most shooting games on account to the high skill floor and the fact that aiming is very important and whatnot, in Overwatch accuracy is important but there are some heroes that you don't even need to aim with like Brigitte, Reinhardt, Moira. They remembered to make the game open for everyone and the game isn't hard to learn, they even give you an optional tutorial to learn the basics of the game, there are also a lot of easy characters like Reinhardt, Bastion, Soldier 76 and Mercy. Overall the game is an amazing shooting for its simplicity and diversity.
I don't know why all the negatives, but this is one of the addictive shooting game out in the market. I cannot put this down, and I wish everyone can give this a chance (and is free).

This game isn't fun. I had played it around the time that Overwatch first released to the public. At the time, it was a 6v6 game with maybe 12 classes. That was enough, honestly. I wasn't a big fan of the game back then, but I am especially not a big fan of the game now. The game is addicting, but not in a good way. It feels like banging your head against a brick wall over and over again at just how unbalanced everything is. It's impossible to que for unranked with friends, because the more friends that you are playing with at once, the more likely it is that you'll be matched against a team of competitive players that are trying to practice. Then, your team of casuals who just want to unwind and shoot some people get curb-stomped and can't even leave spawn.

In other words, it's a lot like playing the game, feeling endless pain, and not being able to call it quits before the pain kicks you down too hard.
If you want my advice, brand-new people to this game should just save themselves some trouble and try a different hero shooter instead.

This game is absolutely not beginner friendly. I just started playing it today and uninstalled it after an hour. It is way too hard and you die too fast. The game looked fun and looked like it had potential for me... I was wrong. After spending match after match trying to find a character and changing my sensitivity, nothing helped. I'm really disappointed because this game looked fun.

I see where people get the negative views from this game. But playing casually with friends is the most fun I have had in a shooter comparatively to other in the same genre. But viewing it from a competitive side, it can be a bit less fun being stuck in elo hell. But I do recommend if playing with people you know and going in with a 'just have fun' mentality.

This game is so fun! 🥰 I’ve loved playing it over the past few months, it’s very enjoyable! 🤩 There’s so many heroes to pick from, with 42 playable heroes, you 42 unique characters to try out 💫 with each one having its own special powers and abilities 🪄 The graphics and sound effects are developed quite remarkably, with great character design and personalities/ backstories for each and every one of them! 🌟 A huge draw is the fact that the game is free! You can literally just try it out for free so you don’t have to worry about wasting your money if you disliked the game (which you probably won’t😼) and there’s also in-game purchases for dedicated players if you want to make it an even more fun experience 🔥 Overall I’ve played many many hours of it, and still look forward to playing more, I truly love the game and would recommend it to everyone 🥹

I am able to play this game most of the time without any problem whatsoever. But sometimes I join a game and fire one shot and the game crashes with a message "your rendering device has been lost". I start the game back up and try to rejoin, but I'm suspended and can't play.

I am suspended. Because their game crashed!? seriously?

I've been playing Overwatch since its beta in October 2015. Coming from Team Fortress 2, I was captivated by Overwatch's character design, unique abilities, and breathtaking cinematics. The game's charm, soul, and story awe inspiring, and it drew players in and kept us invested. And with the story's build up to the launch of a PVE mode players were ecstatic...

Unfortunately, Overwatch "2" feels like a shadow of its former self. While the core gameplay remains fun and can still be enjoyed casually and competitively, the soul of the game has been made hollow. From a gameplay and balance perspective, it's not as bad as some claim, but that's not the reason I can't recomend it... this is:

The marketing is rivaling the some of the worst of the mobile gaming industry. What once was a promise of epic PVE modeds with narrative and creative storytelling has been replaced by relentless monetization. Porsche skins, anime crossovers, Transformers skins—it’s all about skins. Ads scream at you to spend, spend, spend before the "limited time" offers are gone. The game preys on FOMO.

The heart and artistry that made Overwatch special have been tarnished. The original game had a clear philosophy: you paid upfront, and everything—heroes, skins—could be unlocked through gameplay. Now, the game’s focus has shifted to exploiting its fanbase for easy profit. Resources that could have been used to expand the world and enrich the story have been funneled into brand deals and aggressive monetization schemes.

If you love Overwatch for its gameplay, by all means, play it. It’s still possible to have fun. But if you care about preserving what Overwatch once stood for and the art behind it, I urge you: Supporting this business model only ensures the continued decline of what was once a truly great game.

как правильно кипятить воду?
В огромном обилии информационного потока обычный обыватель может спокойно найти все что он того захочет. Как собрать самолет? Как разобрать самолет? Что делать если ты летишь в самолете? Как затролить соседей если ты в самолете?
В этом информационном изобилии очень сложно не потерять себя и действительно важные и нужные навыки.
Например такие навыки как кипячение воды.
Проведя опросы 9 из 10 корреспондентов сказали что играть в овервотч интереснее чем кипячение воды. Выводы делайте сами.
Издано кипячение воды было фундаментальным знанием и использовалось для разных целей в культурах разных эпох. Отсутствие горячей воды в доме еще в древние времена именовали как slidanolecunt что с латыни означало "жесть" .
Даже сейчас этот вопрос может занять вашу голову как только вы решите приготовить чай, суп, фаршмак, или просто захотите притаится на кухне и тихо наблюдать за бурлением воды, в которой мимолетно может выскальзывать только расчлененный сосед, который не знал как вскипятить воду.
Ну что же как это сделать?
Существуют разные вариации того как можно разогреть воду.
Например растирания воды руками, или используя ёмкость которая подноситься на нагревательный элемент (например ложка на жиге), иногда кипяток можно добыть используя преднамеренно разогретое пространство, например сковородку.
После выбора нужного девайса, в моем случае это будет сотейник, стоит добавить в него воду а после поставить на плиту и ждем.
В скором времени вы услышите шум, но не пугайтесь и не пытайтесь его одолеть это будут пузыри бурлящей воды что будут свидетельствовать о закипании воды. Температура в тот момент будет достигать 100 градусов, что создаст испарение воды потому вы сможете повторять этот процесч снова и снова пока не насладитесь....

Okay, let’s be honest. Overwatch 2 is like that one toxic ex you just can’t seem to quit—no matter how much they make you want to scream into a pillow. I hate it, but somehow I keep going back for more. It’s a game that has all the emotional depth of a rollercoaster, but instead of screaming from excitement, it’s more like screaming because your teammates forgot how to play the game.

First off, 5v5? Cool idea, Blizzard. Let’s take one teammate away and then make every single mistake feel like the end of the world. That one bad DPS? You’re now the reason your team is losing. Congratulations. But wait! There's more! With the new hero balancing system, nothing stays the same. Remember when you thought you had a good grasp on the meta? Well, here’s a new patch that will make your favorite hero feel like they’re made of paper. Bye-bye, comfort zone! It’s time to relearn everything you thought you knew… again.

And then there’s the Overwatch 2 community. Ah, yes, the online environment where people pretend to be all about teamwork but will gladly flame you for choosing the wrong hero. That one person who decides they’re the second coming of Mercy and proceeds to not heal you while you’re dying in the middle of the battlefield? Iconic. Let’s not even talk about voice chat, which, at this point, is just an audition for "The Real Housewives of Overwatch." Forget strategy, we’re just here for the drama.

I swear, some days it feels like Overwatch 2 is trying to take me down. I’ve lost count of how many times I’ve hit my head against the desk after losing a match I should’ve won. But guess what? I can’t stop. Like some sort of addiction, it lures me in with the promise of "just one more match" and then leaves me in a pit of existential despair. But hey, at least I’ve mastered the art of losing with grace. Sort of.

Honestly, this game is a mix of fun and rage, with just a pinch of "why am I still doing this?" But in the end, we keep playing, don’t we? Because deep down, we all know that victory is just one really good match away… even if we have to suffer through 50 miserable ones to get there.

So, Overwatch 2, thanks for ruining my evenings and making me question my life choices, but I’ll see you in the next match. Probably.

Playing Overwatch 2 has started to give me nightmares at night, with the intense and fast-paced action from the game spilling into my dreams. The constant adrenaline from playing, the bright, vivid maps, and the chaotic team fights linger in my mind long after I’ve turned off the console. I find myself in strange, distorted versions of the maps, dodging explosive attacks and hearing the echoing sounds of hero abilities and gunfire. The anxiety of losing a match or making a critical mistake in-game follows me into sleep, and I wake up feeling tense, as if the battle never really ended. What should be a fun experience has become a source of stress, turning my peaceful nights into a battleground of its own.

This might have the worst competitive matchmaking system in any game that I've ever played. Recently I just played 3 games in a row where I had teammates leave during the middle of the round, essentially dooming us to lose. That was the end of it for me. I used to really enjoy the game because of the different characters and the abilities, but when your success is determined by the competency of the members on your team, and those team members fail you because the matchmaking purposely pairs you with people who are on a losing streak and prone to leaving, the game becomes a chore. I can't tell you how many times I was on a winning streak, only to be paired up with people who couldn't get more than 3-4 kills the next 7 games. I will never pick this game again, and I would never recommend it to anyone. I wish I could get the time back that I wasted on it because there is no part of it that is fun or worth it anymore.

Overwatch é um jogo de FPS vibrante e acessível, que combina ação rápida com uma forte ênfase no trabalho em equipe. Com uma ampla variedade de heróis únicos, cada um com habilidades distintas, o jogo oferece diversas estratégias e opções de jogo, mantendo a experiência sempre fresca e empolgante. A jogabilidade fluida, aliada à necessidade de cooperação entre os jogadores, cria uma dinâmica envolvente. Além disso, a Blizzard mantém o jogo atualizado com novos heróis, mapas e eventos sazonais, o que garante que Overwatch continue sendo relevante e divertido ao longo do tempo. É uma excelente escolha para quem busca uma experiência estratégica e colaborativa.

Overwatch 2 is a game I would recommend, especially to players who enjoy team-based shooters with diverse characters and strategic gameplay. Here's why:

Why I Recommend Overwatch 2
Accessibility: It's free-to-play, making it easy to try without financial risk.
Variety: The wide selection of heroes and maps keeps the gameplay fresh and exciting.
Team Play: Matches reward coordination, making it fun to play with friends.
Regular Updates: Blizzard frequently adds new heroes, maps, and events to keep the game evolving.
Graphics and Design: Stunning visuals and detailed character designs make it visually appealing.
However, I'd suggest it primarily to players who:

Enjoy competitive multiplayer games.
Like improving through practice and learning new mechanics.
For casual players, the learning curve can be a bit challenging, but Quick Play and Arcade modes make it approachable. Overall, it's a great choice for fans of action-packed, hero-based shooters!

Несмотря на количество говна в Стиме, в своем текущем состоянии игра вполне неплоха. Преимущества все те же: очень быстрый, динамичный геймплей где есть место и грамотному применению способностей с учётом позиций и всего такого, и чистого механа. Количество героев позволяет найти хоть парочку, что вам точно да зайдут. Все это красочно, красиво звучит, светится, пердит. Со второй части даже мета начала периодически меняться, а не стоять столбом как боб на одних и тех же готсах и щилдхеле. Лично мне даже смена на 5на5 вполне нравится, игра скучнее не стала, а вот понимать и влиять на происходящее стало заметно приятнее и проще.
А вот главных проблем по сути две, и все появились именно во второй части. Отвратнейшая, мерзотная монетизация. Тут вам и батлпасы, и по 2к за скин, которые кстати, имхо, несколько упали в качестве дизайна и иногда отдают каким-то пабг мобайл и форточкой. Кстати если вы все таки захотите эти самые скины купить, то можете готовиться к тому что их выход больше распределяется не равномерно, а зависит от того насколько популярен и "продаваем" конкретный персонаж. Отсюда мемы про вентурмейнов и пятый скин на кирико за неделю.
Второй же, самый главный недостаток второго овера - огромное смещение баланса и всего действа в игре в сторону танков. От вашего танка зависит вся ваша игра, если вражеская тима контрпикает вашего танка - танк либо делает свитч, либо вы проиграли. Если ваш танк хуже танка противника - вы скорее всего проиграли. Значение и импакт от хороших действий дпсов и суппортов стал значительно меньше сравнительно с импактом от хороших или плохих действий танка. Посадите гм-танка в бронзу и он поднимется обратно за день. Сделайте тоже самое с гм трейсой и она там ошизеет. Причем складывается ощущение что близард не видят в этом проблемы, систематически повышая выживаемость и силу этой роли в целом, видимо думая что на них никто не играет потому что они слабые.

Started playing OW in 2018. I deleted this game once during the end of GOATs and very beginning of double shield, then made the mistake of reinstalling it again for OW2 because the alpha actually ended up being fun. Fast forward again a year or so when the team continues to make anti-fun heroes and balance decisions and deleted it again. Reinstalled it on a whim (for the first time via Steam) because of Classic mode and I would play this way forever if I could. High-skill characters are actually rewarding, cheese characters are (mostly) bad, healing is bad/lack of immortality-based cooldowns, tanks can actually be punished for poor play, etc. Alas, I will more than likely end up deleting this once again when Classic mode is gone...

Une suite décevante (Un review bomb justifié)
En tant que fan du premier Overwatch, j’attendais beaucoup de Overwatch 2, mais le résultat est franchement décevant. Et vu la colère de la communauté, le review bombing qu’il subit est clairement mérité.

- Le PvE, une fausse promesse
On nous avait vendu un mode PvE ambitieux, mais ce qu’on a eu est ridicule. Le contenu est maigre et répétitif, loin de ce qui avait été annoncé.


Le passage au free-to-play a transformé le jeu en machine à cash. Entre le Battle Pass et les microtransactions, le plaisir de débloquer des skins en jouant a disparu.


Les nouvelles cartes et héros sont là, mais franchement, ça n’apporte rien de vraiment nouveau.

En fin de compte, les promesses de renouveau et de contenu n’ont pas été tenues, les joueurs se retrouvent avec un jeu qui ressemble davantage à une version '' qu'autre chose.
